thread.title: Pharoah Sanders, Archie Shepp, Gary Burton named NEA Jazz Masters for 2016
thread.title_full: Pharoah Sanders, Archie Shepp, Gary Burton named NEA Jazz Masters for 2016

title: Pharoah Sanders, Archie Shepp, Gary Burton named NEA Jazz Masters for 2016
text:
Pharoah Sanders, Archie Shepp, Gary Burton named NEA Jazz Masters for 2016 By: The Associated Press Enlarge Image 
FILE - In this July 25, 2013 file photo, American jazz saxophonist Archie Shepp performs at the Five Continents Jazz Festival in Marseille, southern France. Shepp, along with fellow saxophonist Pharoah Sanders and vibraphonist Gary Burton, are the newest recipients of the 2016 Jazz Masters. The awards will be presented on April 4 at a concert at the Kennedy Center. (AP Photo/Claude Paris, File) 
WASHINGTON - Saxophonists Pharoah Sanders and Archie Shepp and vibraphonist Gary Burton are the newest recipients of the nation's highest jazz honour. 
They have been chosen as the 2016 Jazz Masters by the National Endowment for the Arts, it was announced Thursday. Wendy Oxenhorn, executive director of the Jazz Foundation of America, which assists musicians in need, received the Jazz Masters Award for advocacy. 
Sanders gained prominence in John Coltrane's band, going on to record the spiritually themed, free jazz album "Karma" (1969). Shepp blended avant-garde jazz with African influences on "The Magic of Ju-Ju"(1967) and delivered a powerful civil rights message on the 1972 albums "Attica Blues" and "The Cry of My People." 
Burton, who opened a new musical vocabulary for the vibraphone with his four-mallet technique, has won seven Grammys, mostly for his duets with pianist Chick Corea. 
The awards will be presented on April 4 at a concert at the Kennedy Center in Washington. 
___
